reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: 1. Project: 11591 Promotion of Global Justice #2. Project justification: #The project aims to strengthen FCAs own and partner organisations capacity and level of participation in global human rights processes and involvement in global advocacy work. #3. T he main objective and the expected results:#The main objective is to encourage and increase FCAs own and its partner organisations capacity in participating in international human right processes such as the UN Universal Periodic Review (UPR), CEDAW and ot her UN HR Treaty reporting mechanisms or regional HR mechanisms (e.g. African Charter on Human and Peoples Rights) of the countries under review, or involvement in other global advocacy processes relevant to FCA strategic themes.#The expected results inclu de: FCAs own and the partner organisations capacity to take actively part in the stakeholder meetings, hearings and collection of data as part of civil societys contributions to the preparatory processes for UPR reviews, CEDAW, and other HR mechanisms of t he given country has been increased, is effectively utilized and recognized by the actors involved. Also other global advocacy results based on FCA global strategic advocacy objectives can be counted as results in the project if utilized the resources of t he project (e.g. training, capacity building activities, sharing of information). #4. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: Civil society and the stakeholders they represent, the people the partner organisation is working with, and on global advocacy: all people.# Duty-bearers: The duty-bearers include especially the authorities at different governance levels responsible of the issues being raised and advocated for in global processes.#5. Implementing partner:#This is a global project and will have a few partners, e .g. Lutheran World Federation (LWF) and local partners in programme countries that have the potential to increase their capacity and participate in global HR processes, such as the UPR review and CEDAW. The project will focus on follow up on UPR recommenda tions and suppport to the preparatory processes in a number of FCA programme countries. The project will also allow 5-6 FCA staff and partner representatives to take part in the Gender Advocacy Training in Geneva with the focus of CEDAW advocacy work.

1. Project: 11591 Promotion of Global Justice #2. Also other global advocacy results based on FCA global strategic advocacy objectives can be counted as results in the project if utilized the resources of t he project (e.g. training, capacity building activities, sharing of information). #4. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: Civil society and the stakeholders they represent, the people the partner organisation is working with, and on global advocacy: all people.# Duty-bearers: The duty-bearers include especially the authorities at different governance levels responsible of the issues being raised and advocated for in global processes.#5. Implementing partner:#This is a global project and will have a few partners, e .g. Lutheran World Federation (LWF) and local partners in programme countries that have the potential to increase their capacity and participate in global HR processes, such as the UPR review and CEDAW. The project will focus on follow up on UPR recommenda tions and suppport to the preparatory processes in a number of FCA programme countries. The project will also allow 5-6 FCA staff and partner representatives to take part in the Gender Advocacy Training in Geneva with the focus of CEDAW advocacy work.
